bug.short_desc: The find attributes are not in sync with the available columns in the log view

long_desc.thetext:
Import a log file and click the find toolbar item. Notice that the available find attributes is not in sync with the available columns in the Log View. For example, source component thread id is missing.
The columns displayed for filtering, highlighting, and the find operation must always be in sync.

Also, the sort/choose column dialogs will always add a removed attribute to the end of the unselected attribute list. For example, if the user adds the version as a sort column and later removes it, the field is added to the end of the unselected properties.
We should always keep both lists sorted. There is no need to have a sort button at the bottom of each list. Remove both "sort" buttons and always keep the list alphabetically sorted.

(In reply to comment #1) I agree that the Available columns should but sorted always, but not the Selected Columns, the order of the selected columns are taken into account in how the columns layout in view as well as the priority in columns sorting.
(In reply to comment #2) I agree.
Rough estimate: 10hrs
Target to future. Cannot be contained in 4.4 due to limitation of resource.
This is required from AC perspective

Error printed int the console: Error! Unrecognized bytecode (pc=082DD543, bc=0) in record 66. An error occurred while parsing the buffer

Works OK with 5.0 sr2 on windows.

bug.short_desc: [Viewers] TreeViewer.reveal() does not work with SWT.VIRTUAL

long_desc.thetext:
My application displays a very large tree using a TreeViewer with SWT.VIRTUAL and an ILazyContentProvider. I need to programmatically scroll to a given top level (direct child of root) item. Using TreeViewer.reveal() with a model object as the argument negates the performance advantage of SWT.VIRTUAL because the TreeViewer does a depth-first search of the model tree to find the given object.
I switched the reveal() call to use a TreePath. However, this only works if the user has already manually scrolled so the target of the reveal() has been visible; otherwise the reveal() call does nothing.
The URL for this report has sample code that exhibits this.
I'm going to take a chance that this is JFAce. If you run the example and it is not, please move it back to SWT.
Could you please attach the sample code to this bug report (which puts it under EPL)? Otherwise, I won't be able to look at it. Thanks.
Created an attachment (id=53080) Example code.
Created an attachment (id=53081) Example code (Application)

Thanks, I can reproduce the problemusing your code. Minor nit: The Javadoc for TreeViewer says "This class is not intended to be subclassed outside the viewer framework". For production code, I would recommend instantiating TreeViewer as is rather than subclassing it.

I realize that reveal() will have to instantiate objects until it finds the given object. Howerver, reaveal() with a TreePath could use the information in the tree path to significantly prune the search for the object. It would first instantiate direct children of the root until it found the first itemm in the tree path, and then instantiate children of that object until it found the second item in the path, etc. This is much better than searching the entire tree depth first, as is done when reveal() is given just a model object.
The workaround works great in my application; thank you for the quick response on this.

bug.short_desc: [WorkingSets] Create new working set via copy operation

long_desc.thetext: This feature would facilitate the creation of a large number of sets by allowing copy operations on existing sets, the new ones of which can then be altered and tweaked according to new criteria. As the size of the base set (a.k.a the to-be-copied set) increases, this feature's utility becomes ever more relevant.

bug.short_desc: [WorkingSets] Complex boolean expressions for "calculated" sets

long_desc.thetext:
It would be great to have more complex control over what resources are shown with working sets. Here are a few suggestions:
or(workingSet A, workingSet B) - elements that are in either set not(workingSet A) - any element in the workspace that are not in the set
And when they are allowed to chain together, they can form very complex logic:
and(not(workingSet A), or(workingSet B, workingSet C))
The boolean expression of working sets can be saved as a named set itself, and then enabled / disabled just like any other set.

bug.short_desc: [ActivityMgmt] Support < > in patterns

long_desc.thetext:
I'm trying to add a pattern to exclude a set of plugins that end with a certain word. The regular expression that works is:
(?<!text)
I cannot use the character '<' in the plugin.xml. I also tried < and the unicode character for <, but these don't seem to work.
My current workaround is to add an activityPatternBinding for each of my plugins excluding the ones that end with that particular word. :-(
After talking with you I'm going to mark this as resolved. You seem to have a pattern that now works. Please reopen if the issue continues.

Well, having a workaround doesn't mean this isn't still a problem. :-)
It would be good to support a set a plugins that don't end with a particular word, like this:
org\.eclipse\.wst\.[\.\w/]*(?<!samples?)/[\.\w/]*
I had to create a total of 10 patterns just to get around this one.
How is this a workaround? You asked if you could support patterns such as "(?<!text)" and I showed you how to do it. What are we missing?
Without an answer to my question I will resolve as INVALID again

bug.short_desc: RAServer process dies occasionally

long_desc.thetext: Consuming product playback fails about 1/7 times due to RAServer process gone. While not sure, I think the process disappears at the end of one run as opposed to the start of a new run. Will attach a zip file with a log from the run (product symptom is "timeout" of run) and servicelog.log. This log is default settings. Unfortunately through 20 or so runs was unable to get a failure with level HIGH and DEBUG.
Created an attachment (id=53023) Product log and servicelog.log
Not sure if this is the right component or not, but I'm thinking most likely it should be directed at Samson.
Can you add more description about what is being run? What is new in your playback testing that this problem is just now being seen - or has this been seen previously, but not identified?

This problem did not occur in 3.3. Back then we had no regular "launch over and over" test because everything worked fine. Now in 4.2.1 we are experiencing launch problems with Windows and Linux, so we developed a 50-run test doing 50 full test playbacks.
This latest test was conducted using the recent patch for Linux. That patch fixed a consecutive launch problem from the UI. In some sense mentioning the patch is irrelevant since the disappearing RAServer process occurs using production 4.2.1 also. This test is different from consecutive launches in the UI in that it results in 50 separate instantiations of a headless eclipse.
Investigation in progress.
Kevin, we will see how the 4.3 i3 test pass goes and determine whether the crash still occurs.
Retarget to 4.4 as per 11/08 PMC meeting minutes.
Please resolve as no plan to fix
No plan to fix.

Can you provide a link to the meeting minutes or the snippet from the minutes that describe the justification?
From what I know of this problem, I am assuming this is NPTF due to desire to port to the newer agent controller and address the defects on that new code base. If that's the reasoning, then I'd agree with that approach.
In TPTP 4.4 we will begin shipping AC technology on Linux IA32. We therefore will not be enhancing the RAC on that platform.
Set target to 4.4 i1.

13:34:17.718 !MESSAGE main(java/lang/String[]) [in ABCD [in [Working copy] ABCD.java [in <default> [in src [in Test]]]]] does not exist

confirmed this happens in 1.5 and 1.6 vms, and only seems to happen if you have a method breakpoint set on a static method that has an array in the signature.
The removal of breakpoints occurs only after the refactoring has failed the first time, as the participant is no longer able to work with breakpoint changes.

Happens for static and non static methods that have any parameters. The parameters are unqualified in the source type, but we are providing a qualified signature, so the new method is thought not to exist.
Also happens in 3.2.1

Created an attachment (id=53144) patch
Source methods always have unqualified signatures, so the patch searches the new destination type for a 'similar' method.
Applied patch.
Please verify, Curtis.
Verified

bug.short_desc: Entries in search tree not rendered until selected

long_desc.thetext:
Version: 3.3.0 Build id: I20061031-0656
When you search on the references for something on Vista the search entries come up but one of them (usually the second one) is blank until selected.
STEPS 1) Open a java editor 2) select a field in the outline 3) search for references in the workbench 4) some entries will not be displayed until selected
Created an attachment (id=53024) Screenshot
Tod, are you testing on RC1 or RC2?

Kevin, can you recreate it?
Note that changes were made to TreeItem.setExpanded() that may fail on Vista or may be already fixed by a last minute problem that was fixed in tonight's build. Retest tomorrow.
RC2
Sorry - it is RC1
I have not seen this problem. I'm running RC2. I'll watch for it some more
Have Tod walk over and try and make it happen in Vista RC1 with the exact same code and/or set of steps.
Closing as WORKSFORME. Tod, if you see it again, please reopen.

bug.short_desc: Provide indication that first time log analysis is slow

long_desc.thetext:
The first time XPath analysis is done, the Symptom catalog is compiled and this takes a long time. Would it be possible to provide some indication to the user that the lengthy process happens only on the first time, and subsequent analysis runs faster?
This request is from an IBM customer.
Here is the info from the customer:
The first time the LTA is using the symptom catalogs/databases there is an unusual delay in response and there is no feedback to the user that this is a one time event and the next time this is done it would take less time to do, maybe a pop up is in order?
The customer team is requesting this fix for the TPTP 4.2.1.1 fix pack.

This did not make the cut for inclusion in 4.2.1.1. Because this is not a critical issue and because the fix is not available in 4.3, it cannot be contained in the 4.2.1.1 fix release. Also, because 4.2 stream was translated, any new message or change to the UI needs to be translated which adds additional effort to this fix. Targetting it for 4.4 to develop a fix.
I'll take care of this Eugene

This problem depends on the outcome of https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=162562. If the compiling function of the Fast XPATH implementation is removed from TPTP due to internal JDK API usage, and a builder is used to compile the XPath rules offline then there will not be a delay the first time symptom analysis is done.

hm, I already started working on this bug. I guess I'll wait until bug 162562 is addressed first. In the meanwhile, I'll target this bug to future.
As a note to myself, the classes that are responsible for the XPath compilation are located in: org.eclipse.tptp.platform.provisional.fastxpath.compiler* in the models plugin.
This is required from AC perspective.

Although bug 162562 has been fixed there are still cases in which the catalog won't be compiled so a task label in the analysis job would need to provide a clue to the user that first the rules are compiled when running analysis.
Reassigning defect to monitoring lead.

bug.short_desc: Java Script error

long_desc.thetext:
In BIRT 2.1.0, the following code works,
params["rpCsLabels"].replace("-", " ", "gi");
But, it failed in BIRT 2.1.1.
After I changed it to the following as suggested
params["rpCsLabels"].value.replace("-", " ", "gi");
the report works correctly. But, when I try to preview the result of the dataset, I will get following exception:
A BIRT exception occurred. Plug-in Provider:Eclipse.org Plug-in Name:BIRT Data Engine Plug-in ID:org.eclipse.birt.data Version:2.1.1.v20060922-1058 Error Code:data.engine.BirtException Error Message:A BIRT exception occurred: Error evaluating Javascript expression. Script engine error: TypeError: Cannot call method "replace" of undefined (DataSet[getTotalConfigUnchanged].__bm_beforeOpen#9) Script source: DataSet[getTotalConfigUnchanged].__bm_beforeOpen, line: 1, text: __bm_beforeOpen(). See next exception for more information. Error evaluating Javascript expression. Script engine error: TypeError: Cannot call method "replace" of undefined (DataSet[getTotalConfigUnchanged].__bm_beforeOpen#9) Script source: DataSet[getTotalConfigUnchanged].__bm_beforeOpen, line: 1, text: __bm_beforeOpen()
Fixed@

bug.short_desc: [1.5][compiler] Name clash reported for (correct) eclipse-generated code

long_desc.thetext: Reproduced with 3.2 maintenance stream. This seems to be a incremental build problem. If a full build is done, no error is reported. If I make a change in DoingImpl and recompile, then an error (name clash) is reported.
Same bug in HEAD. I'll prepare a regression test in GenericTypeTest.
Added disabled regression tests in org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler.regression.GenericTypeTest. test1067/1068. 1067 checks the full build scenario and 1068 check the incremental build scenario.

Enabled test1067, which passes. test1068 shows that the problem comes from the binary type binding for S (type parameter declared as S extends Something) being marked with AccInterface - which the matching source type binding of test1067 is not. This happens in BinaryTypeBinding#initializeTypeVariable. This results into the method bindings being considered as incompatible since one of the type parameters is an interface (binary) while the other is a class (source).
*** Bug 167268 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Setting the AccInterface bit is indeed a mistake (leftover from some early days). Removed the offending bit setting, enabled test GenericTypeTest#test1068.
Created an attachment (id=56552) Proposed patch for 3.2.2
Maxime - pls add a regression test for the dup bug 167268.
Released for 3.2.2.
Released for 3.3M5. Fixed
verified for 3.2.2 using build M20070112-1200

bug.short_desc: Different rename behavior than standard Eclipse

long_desc.thetext: In the RSE views, when I copy a file and then paste into the same directory I get a dialog asking to rename or overwrite the file. This is very different behavior from the standard Eclipse resource views (create a file called 'Copy of ...'). I would suggest making this operation consistent with Eclipse standard views.
Hm... both approaches have pros and cons. We'll need to discuss this as a group after 1.0.

The resource navigator does something very similar to RSE, but with a simpler dialog. Instead of asking for a rename or overwrite, it always asks for a rename and supplies the "copy of ..." as a suggestion. I'm not sure the behavior is so different. Perhaps it would be a good thing if it were made completely consistent with the eclipse views.
I showed RSE to a few people at SC06 in Tampa this week and got the same reaction. It would be nice if the behavior was consistent with Eclipse.
I showed RSE to a few people at SC06 in Tampa this week and got the same reaction. It would be nice if the behavior was consistent with Eclipse.

bug.short_desc: ssh connection gets confused

long_desc.thetext: I tried moving a file back and forwards between a folder and 'My Home' a few times in an ssh connection. At some point, according to the file system the folder is empty, but when I try and move the file into the folder I get a dialog saying 'A resource named "xxx" already exists'.
Sounds like a caching problem, perhaps a duplicate of bug 162962? DaveM can you check?
This was a filter caching problem - should be fixed now.

Verified with I20061109-0800 on Windows that the 'xxx already exists' is no longer shown.
However, when verifying the bug I came across two other display update issues. These are tracked in bug 164118 and bug 164119.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991

bug.short_desc: Cancelling overwrite results error dialog RSEG1066U

long_desc.thetext: Move a file into a folder containing a file of the same name using ssh or local connection. At the 'A resourced named "xxx" already exists' dialog, I click cancel. I then see a dialog with title RSEG1066U and the message: Operation failed with exception '0 >= 0'. Clicking on overwrite works ok.
Dave please check this together with bug 162993
I tried to reproduce this but it seems okay. Do you still hit this?

This is now fixed. The problem was that regardless of whether the copy completed or not, a refresh is issued. But in this cancelled case, the copy results in a null filename, and that should not be passed into an event.
Verified - message not received when canceling.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991

bug.short_desc: Automatic refresh cases connections to open in view

long_desc.thetext: I have a few different connections displayed in the view. I closed them all exept for the last connection (in this case dstore). I move a file. When the view is refreshed, one of the other connections will open. This is very confusing.
Is the connection that was opened one to the same host that you did the move on?

This appears to be resolved via the fix for 163381. In the RSE tree, there was a bug where an added tree item for one connection was actually the item for another. In this case, the moved file tree data ends up being the file for another disconnected connection. With the fix, this case should no longer occur.
Verified.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991

bug.short_desc: [Commands] AbstractModelActionDelegate can leave hanging open composite operation

long_desc.thetext:
The WriteCommand class that is used by the AbstractModelActionDelegate to open a composite operation, execute the write command, and then close the composite again can leave the composite open.
It correctly handles the case of a RuntimeException being thrown, closing the composite with the indication that it failed. However, in the case that an Error is thrown (e.g., VirtualMachineErrors of various kinds and AssertionError), the composite is not closed.
Of course, these errors are not supposed to ever occur nor to be recovered, but if they should happen to occur, it can mean that a user has lost the ability to save/recover/etc some valuable data before shutting down the workbench. Moreover, since the operation history is a shared resource, this can prevent execution of further operations in other applications in the same workbench.
Updated target milestone.

bug.short_desc: [CommonNavigator] Problem with clashing overrides for non-nested action provider

long_desc.thetext: Another possible fix is to add the priority attribute to the Navigator action provider extension to only be used if it's a non-nested provider

This issue with the priority being null is a critical one for us in DTP and in Sybase products using DTP. We need a patch or fix for this. I don't want to have to do a one-off copy of the org.eclipse.ui.navigator plug-in for fear of causing issues with other things, but we may have to do just that.
Upping the priority to P1 - Critical.
This will cause problems for DTP Europa and DTP adopters if not addressed in 3.3.

Created an attachment (id=61122) Patch that includes proposed change
This patch includes the two line fix that I'm proposing to fix this issue.
When you override a single provider with two providers, which of the two providers do you expect to be invoked? Or do you expect both?

Created an attachment (id=62459) Provides a fix to allow multiple non-nested action providers to be invoked.
This patch prototypes one possible fix where all overriding action providers are allowed.
Please verify if the latest patch satisfies your requirements.

(In reply to comment #8) > Please verify if the latest patch satisfies your requirements.
Interesting. Ok. So you're proposing that we go in order of plug-in ID? (Sorry I didn't respond sooner, I was on vacation all week last week.)
I don't think this is the best way to go based on what I've seen. The issue is that the nested action provider has a priority attribute, but the non-nested one doesn't, so there's nothing to compare against. Using the plug-in ID will make for some entertaining and possibly unexpected results.
I would think that adding an optional priority attribute to the non-nested action provider would be the better way to go and then use the plug-in ID to resolve cases where more than one provider has the same priority.

The patch actually supports multiple providers; so the priority/order of invocation shouldn't really matter as they should contribute to the menu independently.
Can you describe the use case you're expecting to handle with this? Do you expect all contributions to appear or that one of the overriding action providers would win out?

The use case is pretty simple. For example, let's say we have our generic JDBC connection profile in DTP. It has its own refresh action provider, which can be overridden for specific instances. A DTP adopter writes their own connection profile for their particular database and wants to override the Refresh action provider to do their own specific thing. Within the context of that enablement or target, their provider should win for that particular provider. That's why I was suggesting the priority more than just sorting them by IDs.

Okay. I think this should handle your use case. There's a test (grab org.eclipse.ui.tests.navigator when you apply the patch). In the test case:
Open the "Test Navigator Viewer". Create a project, a folder, two resources, one of which ends with ".txt" Right click on the project and folder to see "overrideABLE" Right click on non-.txt file to see "overridING1" and on the .txt file for overridING2.
The two overriding extensions have priorities and both enable on IResource, with one enabling on IResource && extension == .txt.
McQ approved the new attribute on actionProvider with a +1 on the PMC mailing list.
Fixed for > 20070424.

attachment.desc: Provides a fix to allow multiple non-nested action providers to be invoked.
